contextId.information: The reflexive pronoun "himself" adds emphasis that it was not Jesus who was baptizing, but his disciples. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_rpronouns]])

The reflexive pronoun "himself" is added to emphasize that Jesus had "declared" or said this.. You can translate this in your language in a way that will give emphasis to a person. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_rpronouns]])
The reflexive pronoun "himself" emphasizes that it is the Father, not someone less important, who has testified. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_rpronouns]])
contextId.quote: The Father who sent me has himself testified

contextId.information: The word "himself" is a reflexive pronoun that emphasizes the word "he." (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_rpronouns]])
